Link to FL384 REGIO - Volume AA.zip
Link to FL384 REGIO - Volume AP.zip
Link to FL384 REGIO - Volume B.zip
Link to FL384 REGIO - Volume C.zip

description:
This survey is part of a longitudinal series which examines Europeans’ awareness of and their attitudes towards EU Regional Policy. 
It begins by asking respondents whether they have heard about any EU co-financed projects and, if so, whether they believe those projects have had a positive or negative impact. Respondents are then asked about their familiarity with the two of the EU’s key regional funds, and whether they have benefitted personally from an EU-funded project.
The survey then looks at priorities for the EU Regional Policy from the citizen perspective and about who citizens' consider best placed to take decisions about regional investments, before finally looking at European Territorial cooperation programmes and two EU macro-regional strategies, in the Baltic Sea and Danube river regions. 
#####The results by volumes are distributed as follows:
* Volume A: Countries
* Volume AA: Groups of countries
* Volume A' (AP): Trends
* Volume AA' (AAP): Trends of groups of countries
* Volume B: EU/socio-demographics
* Volume C: Country/socio-demographics
title: Flash Eurobarometer 384: Citizens’ awareness and perceptions of EU regional policy
name: S1075_384
alternative_title: Citizens' awareness and perception of EU Regional policy

						<dct:title xml:lang="en">Flash Eurobarometer 384: Citizens’ awareness and perceptions of EU regional policy </dct:title> <!-- A name given to the resource --><!-- Alternative Title(s), 0..*-->
						<dct:alternative xml:lang="en">Citizens' awareness and perception of EU Regional policy</dct:alternative> <!-- An alternative name for the resource --><ecodp:ckan-name>S1075_384</ecodp:ckan-name><!-- Description, 1..*-->
						<dct:description xml:lang="en">This survey is part of a longitudinal series which examines Europeans’ awareness of and their attitudes towards EU Regional Policy. 
It begins by asking respondents whether they have heard about any EU co-financed projects and, if so, whether they believe those projects have had a positive or negative impact. Respondents are then asked about their familiarity with the two of the EU’s key regional funds, and whether they have benefitted personally from an EU-funded project.
The survey then looks at priorities for the EU Regional Policy from the citizen perspective and about who citizens' consider best placed to take decisions about regional investments, before finally looking at European Territorial cooperation programmes and two EU macro-regional strategies, in the Baltic Sea and Danube river regions. 
#####The results by volumes are distributed as follows:
* Volume A: Countries
* Volume AA: Groups of countries
* Volume A' (AP): Trends
* Volume AA' (AAP): Trends of groups of countries
* Volume B: EU/socio-demographics
* Volume C: Country/socio-demographics  </dct:description><!--An unambiguous reference to the resource within a given context -->
